layer.name: Skill
layer.definition: The ability to do something well; expertise. Not just doing something, but developing competence — getting better through deliberate practice and feedback.

questions.text: I know how to conduct an honest self-examination — I have a practiced method that surfaces what needs to surface.
I can identify the root of a sin pattern, not just its symptoms — I've developed diagnostic skill.
questions.principle: Root cause analysis is a skill

questions.text: I know how to recover quickly after a spiritual failure — I have a practiced restoration process that works.
I can distinguish between conviction (from God) and condemnation (from the enemy or self) with increasing accuracy.
I have practical techniques for fighting specific temptations that work for me — not just generic advice, but tested tactics.
questions.principle: Tactical skill comes from tested experience
